required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Lactate Levels Correlates With Ki-67 in Brain Tumor Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Lactate Levels at Beginning of Surgery Correlates With Ki-67 Labeling Index in Brain Tumors
clinical_study.source: Fundacion Clinic per a la Recerca Biomédica

brief_summary.textblock:
In neurosurgery, brain tumor patients show increased levels of lactate at the beginning of surgery. This has been related to malignancy. Ki-67 is a cell proliferation index used as a marker of tumor mitotic activity.
This research aims to describe the correlation between lactate levels and the Ki-67 index in patients with brain tumor.

detailed_description.textblock:
Lactate levels are used in the evaluation of perfusion status in critical care. Increases not related to a hypoperfusion state are observed in the patient with brain tumors. These increases have been related to type and tumor grade. This observation does not fully explain the variation within the same tumor grade.
Ki-67 label index is a marker of mitotic activity that can be used as proliferation index. It has been associated with histologic grade and survival rate. Provides a quantitative measure of the tumor proliferation status.
The investigators will perform a retrospective analysis of the clinical charts of patients after brain tumor resection. The study will address the relationship between baseline lactate levels and the proliferation index found in tissues biopsies.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the correlation between Lactate levels and Ki-67 Index
primary_outcome.description: Levels of lactate in first blood analysis after anesthesia induction and proliferation index in biopsy results

arm_group.description: Neurosurgical patients between June 2017 and February 2018 for tumoral and non-tumoral craniectomy with lactate levels at the beginning of surgery and Ki-67 index in biopsies.

intervention.description: Correlation between lactate levels and Ki-67 index

study_pop.textblock: Craniectomy cases for tumoral and non-tumoral surgery with lactate levels and biopsy information.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Neurosurgical craniectomy cases
- June 2017 - February 2018
- Valid lactate information after anesthesia induction
- Ki-67 label index informed in biopsies
- Tumor type information confirmed in biopsies
Exclusion Criteria:
- Incomplete lactate or Ki-67 index information

facility.name: Anesthesia department, Hospital Clínic de Barcelona

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Fundacion Clinic per a la Recerca Biomédica
